sense.name: agree
sense.examples: The colors don't harmonize well. The ideas of the delegation harmonize with our own. Though from different parties, the politicians' policies harmonized. John's plaid pants and polka-dot shirt harmonize poorly. The flavors in the dish harmonize well with the wine.

sense.name: write, sing, or play harmony to music
sense.examples: The composer harmonized the vocals in his new opera. The choir harmonized beautifully. Various pitches of woodwinds harmonize well together. Instruments harmonize in well written music. No one can harmonize without a good melody.

sense.name: bring in to consonance
sense.examples: The new students will harmonize their views with the situation. The debates will begin to harmonize desires from both sides. The negotiators try to harmonize demands with available means. Jim and Carol need to harmonize their differences. Divorced people can't harmonize their opinions.
